index.description.message: The mittwald Developer Portal provides developers with the resources they need to integrate mittwald products into their own applications using our API.

index.getting-started.body.message: Follow our how-tos to get started with our API.

index.getting-started.missing.cta.message: Use this project's issue tracker to leave a suggestion.

index.reference.body.message: All endpoints and parameters of our API at a glance, including human readable references and machine readable specifications in the OpenAPI format.

index.sdks.body.message: Make it easy for yourself and use one of our SDKs or libraries to integrate our API into your application:

index.sdks.own-sdks.message: Have you built your own library that uses our API?

index.sdks.issue.message: Let us know, and we'll link it here!

components.OperationHint.text.message: For details please refer to the endpoint documentation for the following endpoint

components.OperationHint.text.plural.message: For details please refer to the endpoint documentations for the following endpoints

compat.body.message: This documentation requires the following mStudio features which might not be available in all hosting plans

theme.admonition.warning.description: The default label used for the Warning admonition (:::warning)

theme.DocSidebarItem.expandCategoryAriaL.description: The ARIA label to expand the sidebar category

theme.DocSidebarItem.collapseCategoryAri.description: The ARIA label to collapse the sidebar category

theme.unlistedContent.message.message: This page is unlisted. Search engines will not index it, and only users having a direct link can access it.

index.api.title.message: Automate and integrate with our API

index.api.body.message: Our API allows you to manage your mittwald products and services programmatically. You can use it to automate tasks, integrate our services into your own applications, or build entirely new applications on top of our platform.

index.reference.tutorials.message: We also provide tutorials and examples to help you get started with our API.

index.deploy.body.message: Deploy your applications and services to our platform with ease. We support a variety of programming languages, frameworks and databases.

index.deploy.platform.body.message: Our platform provides a variety of features to help you deploy your applications and services:

index.deploy.tools.body.message: We provide a variety of tools, integrations and tutorials to help you deploy your applications and services:

theme.docs.DocCard.categoryDescription.p.description: The default description for a category card in the generated index about how many items this category includes

index.contributing.title.message: Build your own extensions for the mStudio marketplace

index.contributing.body.message: Read our documentation about contributing content to the mStudio Store

index.contributing.extensions.body.message: These guides will help you get started with building extensions for the mStudio marketplace.

index.contributing.tools.body.message: These guides will help you get started with building extensions for the mStudio marketplace.

index.contributing.tools.flow.message: The mittwald design system and React component library.

index.contributing.tools.edm.message: A utility application to help you implement the required extension webhooks and manage the lifecycle of your extension installations.

index.contributing.flow.message: Use Flow, the mittwald design system, to develop frontends

index.contributing.more-soon.message: More Contribution Possibilities are coming soon.

openapi.operation.metadata.operationidhe.message: Operation IDs are used to uniquely identify operations within an API, independent of the path or method. They are typically used by code generators to generate method names or function calls.

openapi.operation.metadata.deprecationno.message: This operation is deprecated and should not be used anymore. Please refer to this operation's description for alternatives.

index.contribution.title.message: Build your own extensions for the mStudio marketplace

index.contribution.body.message: The mStudio marketplace is a platform for developers to build and distribute their own extensions. You can create extensions that integrate with the mStudio API and add new features to the mStudio platform.

index.contribution.extensions.body.message: These guides will help you get started with building extensions for the mStudio marketplace.

index.contribution.tools.body.message: These guides will help you get started with building extensions for the mStudio marketplace.

index.contribution.tools.flow.message: The mittwald design system and React component library.

index.contribution.tools.edm.message: A utility application to help you implement the required extension webhooks and manage the lifecycle of your extension installations.

cli.img.alt.message: An example usage of the mittwald CLI. The screenshot shows how to list projects and how to install a new Wordpress instance using the CLI.

cli.dev.body.message: The mittwald CLI can integrate seamlessly into your development workflow. It can simplify your development tasks and even help you set up your local development environment.

cli.dev.features.body.message: Typical development tasks that can be simplified with the mittwald CLI include:

cli.dev.features.bootstrapping.message: Bootstrapping new projects on the mittwald platform

cli.scripting.body.message: With our CLI, you can automate your workflows and repetitive tasks by writing scripts. The CLI is built with scripting in mind and supports both interactive and non-interactive modes.

cli.scripting.usecases.body.message: By using the CLI in your scripts, you can easily automate repetitive tasks without the need to interact with the web interface or knowing your way around the API. Typical use cases include:
